issue.title: The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call.
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help.

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Terraform Version

1.6.2

### AzureRM Provider Version

3.78.0

### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

None

### Terraform Configuration Files

```hcl
Trying to update Azurerm sql elastic pool.
```


### Debug Output/Panic Output

```shell
Error: Plugin did not respond

  with azurerm_mssql_elasticpool.rg_pri_sol_sql_ep,
  on sql-server-elastic-pools.tf line 1, in resource "azurerm_mssql_elasticpool" "rg_pri_sol_sql_ep":
   1: resource "azurerm_mssql_elasticpool" "rg_pri_sol_sql_ep" {

The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call. The plugin logs may contain more details.

Stack trace from the terraform-provider-azurerm_v3.78.0_x5.exe plugin:

panic: Error reading level state: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "268435456000": value out of range

goroutine 162 [running]:
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*ResourceData).get(0x193e5680, {0x197b6068, 0x1, 0x1}, 0x8)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/resource_data.go:556 +0x28f
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*ResourceData).State(0x193e5680)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/resource_data.go:354 +0x463

        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/resource.go:670 +0x1e8
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*GRPCProviderServer).ReadResource(0x182ed940, {0x8e58ec0, 0x1978ed98}, 0x193efe40)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/grpc_provider.go:623 +0x238
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/tf5server.(*server).ReadResource(0x183c1c20, {0x8e58ec0, 0x1978eb10}, 0x193f5650)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.19.0/tfprotov5/tf5server/server.go:789 +0x481
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5._Provider_ReadResource_Handler({0x82d1b60, 0x183c1c20}, {0x8e58ec0, 0x1978eb10}, 0x188929c0, 0x0)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.19.0/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5/tfplugin5_grpc.pb.go:431 +0x176
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).processUnaryRPC(0x180d2780, {0x8e62210, 0x1900e120}, 0x18c3a460, 0x18fb0f90, 0xe66cbd4, 0x0)
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.3/server.go:1374 +0xed9
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).handleStream(0x180d2780, {0x8e62210, 0x1900e120}, 0x18c3a460, 0x0)
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.3/server.go:1751 +0xa02
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1.1()
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.3/server.go:986 +0xe1
created by google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1 in goroutine 68

Error: The terraform-provider-azurerm_v3.78.0_x5.exe plugin crashed!

This is always indicative of a bug within the plugin. It would be immensely
helpful if you could report the crash with the plugin's maintainers so that it
can be fixed. The output above should help diagnose the issue.

### Expected Behaviour

should bring complete plan and successfully apply

### Actual Behaviour

It brings an incomplete plan thus failed to apply

### Steps to Reproduce

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_

issue.title: New Resource: `azurerm_key_vault_managed_hardware_security_module_role_definition` and `azurerm_key_vault_managed_hardware_security_module_role_assignment` for managed HSM
issue.body: AccTest failure nto caused by this PR.

comment.body:
Hi @wuxu92
Apologies for the lack of feedback on this one.  I have a partial review done, but we've been investigating and working on removing a blocker in the more recent version of the API that would break Managed HSM's in the provider via the `kermit` SDK generation process if this resource is merged before it is fixed. This work is still ongoing, but as soon as it's complete, we will be able to unblock this PR and complete the review. 

Thanks!

review.body:
Hi @wuxu92 thanks for submitting this. I ran the tests and it looks like there is one failure:

```
------- Stdout: -------
=== RUN   TestAccRoleAssignment_ServicePrincipalGroup
=== PAUSE TestAccRoleAssignment_ServicePrincipalGroup
=== CONT  TestAccRoleAssignment_ServicePrincipalGroup
    testcase.go:113: Step 1/1 error: After applying this test step and performing a `terraform refresh`, the plan was not empty.
        stdout

        -/+ destroy and then create replacement

issue.title: PostgreSQL Flexible Server error
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Terraform Version

1.1.9

### AzureRM Provider Version

3.4.0

### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

azurerm_postgresql_flexible_server

### Terraform Configuration Files

```hcl
provider "azurerm" {
  features {}
}

resource "azurerm_resource_group" "example" {
  name     = "example-resources"
  location = "West Europe"
}

resource "azurerm_postgresql_flexible_server" "example" {
  name                   = "example-psqlflexibleserver"
  resource_group_name    = azurerm_resource_group.example.name
  location               = azurerm_resource_group.example.location
  version                = "12"
  administrator_login    = "psqladmin"
  administrator_password = "H@Sh1CoR3!"

  storage_mb = 32768

  sku_name = "GP_Standard_D4s_v3"
}
```


### Debug Output/Panic Output

```shell
│ Error: waiting for creation of the Postgresql Flexible Server "example-psqlflexibleserver" (Resource Group "example-resources"): Code="ServerGroupDropping" Message="Operations on a server group in dropping state are not allowed."
│ 
│   with azurerm_postgresql_flexible_server.example,
│   on main.tf line 10, in resource "azurerm_postgresql_flexible_server" "example":
│   10: resource "azurerm_postgresql_flexible_server" "example" {
```


### Expected Behaviour

_No response_

### Actual Behaviour

_No response_

### Steps to Reproduce

_No response_

### Important Factoids

_No response_

### References

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/postgresql_flexible_server

issue.title: azurerm_dns_a_record  Error: Provider produced inconsistent final plan
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help.

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Terraform Version

1.3.9

### AzureRM Provider Version

3.65.0

### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

azurerm_dns_a_record 

### Terraform Configuration Files

```hcl
resource "azurerm_dns_a_record" "compose-apex" {
  zone_name           = azurerm_dns_zone.compose.name
  resource_group_name = local.rg_name
  name                = "@"
  ttl     = 600
  records = [data.azurerm_public_ip.compose-load-balancer.ip_address]
  tags = local.tags
}
```


### Debug Output/Panic Output

```shell
The terraform apply fails with the following error, though the deployment was a success:
╷
│ Error: Provider produced inconsistent final plan
│ 
│ When expanding the plan for module.<MODULE NAME>.azurerm_dns_a_record.compose-apex
│ to include new values learned so far during apply, provider
│ "registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/azurerm" produced an invalid new value for
│ .timeouts: was absent, but now present.
│ 
│ This is a bug in the provider, which should be reported in the provider's
│ own issue tracker.
╵

The DNS configuration was not intentionally modified in the configuration but the plan indicates that it needed to be refreshed (redacted text encompassed by < >):
# module.<MODULE NAME>.azurerm_dns_a_record.compose-apex will be updated in-place
  ~ resource "azurerm_dns_a_record" "compose-apex" {
        id                  = "/subscriptions/****/resourceGroups/<RG>/providers/Microsoft.Network/dnsZones/<DNS Zone>/A/@"
        name                = "@"
      ~ records             = [
          - "<IP>",
        ] -> (known after apply)
        tags                = {
            <TAG KEY> = <TAG VALUE>
        }
        # (4 unchanged attributes hidden)
    }
```


### Expected Behaviour

The terraform deployment should complete without generating an error condition.

### Actual Behaviour

Terraform apply generated an error condition when producing the 'final plan'.

### Steps to Reproduce

terraform apply '-input=false' target/terraform.plan


### Important Factoids

We have 6 deployments using the same terraform configuration (different data for different dns zones etc) and only one that is generating this error.

### References

_No response_

comment.body:
@myc2h6o A slight variation on the same theme

Terraform v1.5.7
hashicorp/azurerm v3.77.0

╷
│ Error: Provider produced inconsistent final plan
│ 
│ When expanding the plan for module.itron.azurerm_dns_a_record.compose-apex
│ to include new values learned so far during apply, provider
│ "registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/azurerm" produced an invalid new value for
│ .timeouts: was present, but now absent.
│ 
│ This is a bug in the provider, which should be reported in the provider's
│ own issue tracker.
╵

issue.title: terraform-provider-azurerm plugin crashes since last week
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help.

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Terraform Version

1.4.6

### AzureRM Provider Version

3.35.0

### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

azurerm_kubernetes_cluster

### Terraform Configuration Files

```hcl
Unable to provide.
```


### Debug Output/Panic Output

```shell
Error: Plugin did not respond

The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call. The plugin logs may contain more details.

panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x0 pc=0x4d5725f]

goroutine 211 [running]:
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/internal/services/containers.resourceKubernetesClusterRead(0x1bf7cc80, {0x5d6c480, 0x1b586f00})
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/internal/services/containers/kubernetes_cluster_resource.go:2018 +0x96f
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*Resource).read(0x1bd2caf0, {0x6d8eaa0, 0x1bb2aca8}, 0x1bf7cc80, {0x5d6c480, 0x1b586f00})
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.24.1/helper/schema/resource.go:712 +0x166
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*Resource).RefreshWithoutUpgrade(0x1bd2caf0, {0x6d8eaa0, 0x1bb2aca8}, 0x1ce83c70, {0x5d6c480, 0x1b586f00})
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.24.1/helper/schema/resource.go:1015 +0x547
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*GRPCProviderServer).ReadResource(0x1b831820, {0x6d8eaa0, 0x1bb2ac48}, 0x1bf551a0)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.24.1/helper/schema/grpc_provider.go:613 +0x4f4
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/tf5server.(*server).ReadResource(0x1ba5d900, {0x6d8eaa0, 0x1bb2a978}, 0x1bf7a510)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.14.1/tfprotov5/tf5server/server.go:748 +0x4c5
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5._Provider_ReadResource_Handler({0x62caf40, 0x1ba5d900}, {0x6d8eaa0, 0x1bb2a978}, 0x1ba68200, 0x0)
        github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.14.1/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5/tfplugin5_grpc.pb.go:349 +0x18a
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).processUnaryRPC(0x1b7c4120, {0x6d9826c, 0x1c1ab0e0}, 0x1ceac0a0, 0x1c37d2c0, 0xacb04e8, 0x0)
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.50.1/server.go:1340 +0xe22
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).handleStream(0x1b7c4120, {0x6d9826c, 0x1c1ab0e0}, 0x1ceac0a0, 0x0)
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.50.1/server.go:1713 +0xa17
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1.2()
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.50.1/server.go:965 +0xb1
created by google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1
        google.golang.org/grpc@v1.50.1/server.go:963 +0x25f

Error: The terraform-provider-azurerm_v3.35.0_x5.exe plugin crashed!
```


### Expected Behaviour

Upgrade the final aks environment, with the same config as other successful upgrades just 2 weeks before.
System pool is upgraded 1.25.11
Node pools are upgraded to 1.25.11
Upgrade is complete. 
Repeats the process up to 1.27.1


### Actual Behaviour

Updated AKS in multiple environments with same configs over a few weeks.
This week the same was to be done in the final environment and then received the issue above.
Provider crashes with multiple azurerm errors during `terraform plan`.

Does a one time workaround, upgrades with `azure cli` without issues. AKS upgrade to 1.25.11 is complete. 
Upgrading the then done all the way to 1.27.1 (step by step) as that was the final upgrade we did from terraform in the other environments.
Goes back into terraform to fix the issues for future updates.

Runs `terraform plan` and the provider crashes.
Console suggests removing `azurerm_kubernetes_cluster` module from the state so it is done.
Runs `terraform rm {module state}` 
Runs `terraform import {module state} {resourceId}`
Provider crashes as the messages above (can't important external aks anymore).
Runs `terraform plan` again and it works but as expected the AKS is no longer in the state.

A colleague suggested that I should upgrade our provider, as it is quite old.
Upgraded a couple of versions 3.33.0 -> 3.35.0 with `terraform init -upgrade` but still getting the same issue.

Doubt upgrading the provider further will fix the issue as we it worked with the older version just a few weeks ago. Expecting that it is related to recent open source changes made last week. 

Sorry for the bad information, not used to interacting with open source communities.

### Steps to Reproduce

Try repeating the process of what happened under **Actual Behaviour** with the same provider versions.

### Important Factoids

_No response_

### References

_No response_

comment.body: @frugalpanda did the suggestion from @yildizbilal work for you?

issue.title: Terraform aks code is not updating nodecount in nodepools
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Description

issue.title: Support for additional scopes in azurerm_synapse_role_assignment
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help.

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Description

Currently, only `workspace` and `spark_pool` are supported as scopes for the azurerm_synapse_role_assignment. However, in the API (and in the GUI), these role assignments can be assigned on a more granular scope (eg. `Synapse Credential User` on a single linked key vault, or `SQL administrator` on a specific SQL pool, or Synapse Credential User on a specific user-assigned identity,...).

In a way this is already supported, but only for spark pools. 

### New or Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

azurerm_synapse_role_assignment

### Potential Terraform Configuration

```hcl
resource "azurerm_synapse_linked_service" "example" {
  name                 = "example"
  synapse_workspace_id = azurerm_synapse_workspace.example.id
  type                 = "AzureBlobStorage"
  type_properties_json = <<JSON
{
  "connectionString": "${azurerm_storage_account.example.primary_connection_string}"
}
JSON
  integration_runtime {
    name = azurerm_synapse_integration_runtime_azure.example.name
  }
}

data "azurerm_client_config" "current" {}

resource "azurerm_synapse_role_assignment" "example" {
  scope = azurerm_synapse_linked_service.example.id
  role_name            = "Synapse SQL Administrator"
  principal_id         = data.azurerm_client_config.current.object_id
}
```


### References

- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/synapse/data-plane/role-assignments/create-role-assignment

issue.title: azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension conflict error when both release_train and version are set
issue.body: ### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues ### Community Note * Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request * Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request * If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help. ### Terraform Version 1.6.2 ### AzureRM Provider Version 3.76.0 ### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s) azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension ### Terraform Configuration Files ```hcl resource "azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension" "apim" { cluster_id = local.cluster_id extension_type = "Microsoft.ApiManagement.Gateway" name = "api-arc-${var.name}" release_train = "preview" version = "1.6.4" target_namespace = "apim" identity { type = "SystemAssigned" } configuration_protected_settings = { "gateway.auth.token" = var.gateway_auth_key "monitoring.ingestionKey" = "" } configuration_settings = { "service.type" = "LoadBalancer" "service.http.port" = "8080" "service.http.nodePort" = "" "service.https.port" = "8081" "gateway.id" = local.gateway_id "gateway.configuration.uri" = "api-${var.name}-002.configuration.azure-api.net" "gateway.configuration.backup.enabled" = true "gateway.configuration.backup.persistentVolumeClaim.storageClassName" = "" "telemetry.metrics.opentelemetry.enabled" = false "telemetry.metrics.opentelemetry.collector.uri" = "" "replicaCount" = "1" "monitoring.workspaceId" = "" "monitoring.customResourceId" = local.apim_service_id "highAvailability.enabled" = true "dapr.enabled" = false "dapr.app.id" = "" } } ``` ### Debug Output/Panic Output ```shell ╷ │ Error: Conflicting configuration arguments │ │ with azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension.apim, │ on main.tf line 18, in resource "azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension" "apim": │ 18: release_train = "preview" │ │ "release_train": conflicts with version ╵ ╷ │ Error: Conflicting configuration arguments │ │ with azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension.apim, │ on main.tf line 19, in resource "azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension" "apim": │ 19: version = "1.6.4" │ │ "version": conflicts with release_train ╵ ``` ### Expected Behaviour It should create the extension in the following way: - Allow `Release Train` to be something other than `stable`, in this case, `preview`. - Pin a `version`, in the case, `1.6.4` - Set `Auto Upgrade Minor Version` to `False`. As an example, the following *az cli* command works in the previously described manor: ```shell az k8s-extension create -g rg-awg-aio-tst --cluster-name arc-awg-aio-tst --cluster-type connectedClusters --extension-type Microsoft.ApiManagement.Gateway --name api-arc-awg-aio-tst --release-train preview --version 1.6.4 --auto-upgrade false --config-file arc-apim-settings.json --config-protected-file arc-apim-protected-settings.json ``` Which produces the following extension in the portal: ### Actual Behaviour The `azurerm` terraform provider produces a Conflict error when `version` and `release_train` are set at the same time. ### Steps to Reproduce _No response_ ### Important Factoids _No response_ ### References _No response_

As an example, the following *az cli* command works in the previously described manor: ```shell az k8s-extension create -g rg-awg-aio-tst --cluster-name arc-awg-aio-tst --cluster-type connectedClusters --extension-type Microsoft.ApiManagement.Gateway --name api-arc-awg-aio-tst --release-train preview --version 1.6.4 --auto-upgrade false --config-file arc-apim-settings.json --config-protected-file arc-apim-protected-settings.json ``` Which produces the following extension in the portal: ### Actual Behaviour The `azurerm` terraform provider produces a Conflict error when `version` and `release_train` are set at the same time. ### Steps to Reproduce _No response_ ### Important Factoids _No response_ ### References _No response_

commits.message:
Remove version/release_trian conflict from arc_kuberenetes_cluster_extension_resource  (#23692)

* Remove conflict for release_train and version as these fields are allowed together

* Update azurerm_arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension acctest to have release_train set in complete test

pull_request.title: Remove version/release_trian conflict from arc_kuberenetes_cluster_extension_resource
pull_request.body:
This PR addresses issue #23690.

- Removed the conflict between `version` and `release_train`.

I executed the acceptance tests that relate to `arc_kubernetes_cluster_extension_resource.go` and verified that they all pass. Since this is an edge case where a version and a release train could potentially be removed for an extension in the future, I did not add an acceptance test to avoid a future broken test case.

issue.title: Destruction of Azure IoT Hub (azurerm_iothub) results to error: Plugin did not respond
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Community Note

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

* Please vote on this issue by adding a :thumbsup: [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or "me too" comments, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment and review the [contribution guide](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/blob/main/contributing/README.md) to help.

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->


### Terraform Version

1.6.2

### AzureRM Provider Version

3.77.0

### Affected Resource(s)/Data Source(s)

azurerm_iothub

### Terraform Configuration Files

```hcl
resource "azurerm_iothub" "azure_iot_hub" {
  name                = "iottestmodulexx"
  resource_group_name = "anyrg"
  location            = "westeurope"

  sku {
    name     = "S1"
    capacity = "1"
  }

  identity {
    type = "SystemAssigned"
  }

}
```


### Debug Output/Panic Output

```shell
Stack trace from the terraform-provider-azurerm_v3.77.0_x5 plugin:

panic: time: unknown unit ":" in duration "00:00:15s"

goroutine 105 [running]:
github.com/Azure/go-autorest/autorest/azure.Future.GetPollingDelay({{0x9983098?, 0xc00225ae70?}})
github.com/Azure/go-autorest/autorest@v0.11.29/azure/async.go:185 +0xad
github.com/Azure/go-autorest/autorest/azure.(*Future).WaitForCompletionRef(0xc002c47f80, {0x9968ed8?, 0xc00225ad90?}, {{0x9949e40, 0xc0000504e0}, {0x994c4a0, 0xc001eeb4a0}, 0xc001eeb4d0, 0x0, 0x6fc23ac00, ...})
github.com/Azure/go-autorest/autorest@v0.11.29/azure/async.go:218 +0x1a5
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/internal/services/iothub.resourceIotHubDelete(0xc0012b0800, {0x8215d80?, 0xc001ae4900})
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/internal/services/iothub/iothub_resource.go:951 +0x331
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*Resource).delete(0x9968e30?, {0x9968e30?, 0xc000daf650?}, 0xd?, {0x8215d80?, 0xc001ae4900?})
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/resource.go:817 +0x163
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*Resource).Apply(0xc00113b880, {0x9968e30, 0xc000daf650}, 0xc0020a7930, 0xc0012b0780, {0x8215d80, 0xc001ae4900})
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/resource.go:878 +0x605
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2/helper/schema.(*GRPCProviderServer).ApplyResourceChange(0xc000659a58, {0x9968e30?, 0xc000daf560?}, 0xc0012267d0)
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-sdk/v2@v2.29.0/helper/schema/grpc_provider.go:1060 +0xdbc
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/tf5server.(*server).ApplyResourceChange(0xc001518820, {0x9968e30?, 0xc000daeb70?}, 0xc00225a5b0)
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.19.0/tfprotov5/tf5server/server.go:859 +0x56a
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5._Provider_ApplyResourceChange_Handler({0x8cecde0?, 0xc001518820}, {0x9968e30, 0xc000daeb70}, 0xc00225a540, 0x0)
github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go@v0.19.0/tfprotov5/internal/tfplugin5/tfplugin5_grpc.pb.go:467 +0x169
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).processUnaryRPC(0xc0002a81e0, {0x997a560, 0xc001a381a0}, 0xc000db05a0, 0xc00192f4d0, 0xf5219f8, 0x0)
google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.0/server.go:1376 +0xde7
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).handleStream(0xc0002a81e0, {0x997a560, 0xc001a381a0}, 0xc000db05a0, 0x0)
google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.0/server.go:1753 +0x9e7
google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1.1()
google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.0/server.go:998 +0x8d
created by google.golang.org/grpc.(*Server).serveStreams.func1 in goroutine 40
google.golang.org/grpc@v1.58.0/server.go:996 +0x165

Error: The terraform-provider-azurerm_v3.77.0_x5 plugin crashed!

This is always indicative of a bug within the plugin. It would be immensely
helpful if you could report the crash with the plugin's maintainers so that it
can be fixed. The output above should help diagnose the issue.
```


### Expected Behaviour

Apply of the destroy should run without the error

### Actual Behaviour

Apply errored with the error above but the resource is deleted in Azure Resource Group

### Steps to Reproduce

- Plan and Apply in TFC
- Run manually destroy plan in Terraform Cloud or delete resource from tf-file (both triggers result into the error while applying the deletetion)

### Important Factoids

Tried also using Terraform version 1.5.0 and/or Provider version 3.20.0/3.60.0

### References

_No response_

comment.body: This is affecting use also in North Europe with Iot Hub removal.

pull_request.title: `azurerm_redis_enterprise_cluster` - upgrade api version and support new skus
pull_request.body:
As requested by the service team, the `Enterprise_E5`, `Enterprise_E200` and `Enterprise_E400` SKUs of resource `azurerm_redis_enterprise_cluster` are supported.

Notes: 

- Given supporting new SKUs is just a simple updates, it is merged with the upgrade API into one PR.

- Although this is a preview release, the service team has promised that there won't be any breaking changes.

- Due to the comments in https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/pull/23185, this change does not have test cases but is tested locally.

comment.body: FWIW this function can be replaced by `redisenterprise.PossibleValuesForSkuName()` which will give us all the possible values for the `SkuName` constant (which is the list below) - meaning we'll get these automatically in future SDK upgrades

pull_request.title: `azurerm_redis_enterprise_cluster` - upgrade api version and support new skus
pull_request.body:
As requested by the service team, the `Enterprise_E5`, `Enterprise_E200` and `Enterprise_E400` SKUs of resource `azurerm_redis_enterprise_cluster` are supported.

Notes: 

- Given supporting new SKUs is just a simple updates, it is merged with the upgrade API into one PR.

- Although this is a preview release, the service team has promised that there won't be any breaking changes.

- Due to the comments in https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/pull/23185, this change does not have test cases but is tested locally.
